Package ohos.ivihardware.tbox

Class TBoxManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.tbox.TBoxManager

  • public class TBoxManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A public class that obtains T-Box signal information.

    This class provides basic T-Box signal identifiers, access types, and access methods. You can use the defined T-Box signal identifiers to obtain specified signal values.

    The vehicle T-Box provides signals for the following components: XCall and BatteryCharging.

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.TBOX

    • Field Detail

      • ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDEND

        public static final java.lang.String ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDEND
        Identifies the signal for which to set the end time of a scheduled battery charging.

        The signal value contains the following fields:

        • Whether to end scheduled battery charging
        • Battery charging end time: hour and minute
        • Repeating date

        Data type: byte buffer

        Type: actuator

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDSTART

        public static final java.lang.String ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDSTART
        Identifies the signal for which to set the start time of a scheduled battery charging.

        The signal value contains the following fields:

        • Whether to start scheduled battery charging
        • Battery charging start time: hour and minute
        • Repeating date

        Data type: byte buffer

        Type: actuator

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ID_TBOX_BCALL_STATUS

        public static final java.lang.String ID_TBOX_BCALL_STATUS
        Identifies the bCall signal.

        The signal value contains the following fields:

        • XCall type
        • Call state
        • Call mode
        • Call type
        • Phone number
        • Error code

        Data type: byte buffer

        Type: sensor

        Since:
        3

    • Method Detail

      • getProperty

        public static byte[] getProperty​(java.lang.String tboxPropertyId)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                 java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the specified T-Box signal value.

        You can obtain only the T-Box signal values that support query and subscription. The signal values are of the byte array type. You must use the data format defined by Protocol Buffers to parse the signal values.

        Sample code for obtaining a T-Box signal value: 

         
 try {
     byte[] signalValue = TBoxManager.getProperty(TBoxManager.ID_TBOX_BCALL_STATUS);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        tboxPropertyId - Identifies the T-Box signal to obtain.
        Returns:
        Returns the signal value in a byte array, which needs to be parsed based on the specified format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input tboxPropertyId does not exist, cannot be obtained, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • setActuator

        public static void setActuator​(java.lang.String tboxActuatorId,
                               TBoxActuatorCallback callback,
                               byte[] value)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                               ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                               java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the specified T-Box signal value.

        You can set only the T-Box signal values that support setting. The signal values are of the byte array type. You must use the data format defined by Protocol Buffers to parse the signal values.

        Sample code for setting a T-Box signal value: 

         
 String tboxActuatorId = TBoxManager.ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDEND;
 byte[] value = new byte[10];
 TboxActuatorCallback callback = new TboxActuatorCallback() {
     @Override
     public void onErrorActuator(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 };
 try {
     TBoxManager.setActuator(tboxActuatorId, callback, value);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        tboxActuatorId - Identifies the T-Box signal of the actuator type.
        callback - Indicates the setting error callback.
        value - Indicates the signal value in a byte array, which needs to be parsed based on the specified format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input tboxPropertyId does not exist, cannot be set, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • subscribeProperty

        public static TBoxSubscription subscribeProperty​(java.lang.String tboxPropertyId,
                                                 TBoxPropertyCallback callback,
                                                 long interval)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                 ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                                 java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Subscribes to the specified T-Box signal value.

        You can subscribe to only the T-Box signal values that support query and subscription. The signal values are of the byte array type. You must use the data format defined by Protocol Buffers to parse the signal values.

        Two subscription modes are available:

        • Periodic subscription: The period must be a positive integer multiple of 200 (minimum value: 200), in milliseconds. For example, if the subscription period is set to 400 ms, the subscribed signal value will be reported at an interval of 400 ms.
        • Aperiodic subscription: The period must be Long.MAX_VALUE. The subscribed signal value will be reported only when it changes at the VSA layer.

        Sample code for aperiodically subscribing to a T-Box signal value: 

         String tboxPropertyId = TBoxManager.ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDSETTING;
 long interval = Long.MAX_VALUE;
 TboxPropertyCallbackImpl implements TboxPropertyCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 TBoxSubscription subscription = null;
 TboxPropertyCallbackImpl callback = new TboxPropertyCallbackImpl();
 try {
     subscription = TBoxManager.subscribeProperty(tboxPropertyId, callback, interval);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };

        Sample code for periodically subscribing to a T-Box signal value: 

         String tboxPropertyId = TBoxManager.ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDSETTING;
 long interval = 400;
 TboxPropertyCallbackImpl implements TboxPropertyCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 TBoxSubscription subscription = null;
 TboxPropertyCallbackImpl callback = new TboxPropertyCallbackImpl();
 try {
     subscription = TBoxManager.subscribeProperty(tboxPropertyId, callback, interval);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        tboxPropertyId - Identifies the T-Box signal to subscribe to.
        callback - Indicates the subscription callback.
        interval - Indicates the subscription period. For a periodic subscription, the value must be an integer multiple of 200 (minimum value: 200). For an aperiodic subscription, the value must be Long.MAX_VALUE. Each signal value can be subscribed to either in periodic or aperiodic manner.
        Returns:
        Returns the subscription descriptor (used for unsubscription) if the subscription is successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input tboxPropertyId does not exist or callback is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • unsubscribeProperty

        public static void unsubscribeProperty​(TBoxSubscription subscription)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                       ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                       java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from the specified T-Box signal value.

        You must use the subscription descriptor returned by subscribeProperty(java.lang.String, ohos.ivihardware.tbox.model.TBoxPropertyCallback, long) as the value for the input parameter subscription.

        Sample code for unsubscribing from a T-Box signal value: 

         String tboxPropertyId = TBoxManager.ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDSETTING;
 long interval = Long.MAX_VALUE;
 TboxPropertyCallbackImpl implements TboxPropertyCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 TboxPropertyCallbackImpl callback = new TboxPropertyCallbackImpl();
 TBoxSubscription subscription = null;
 try {
     subscription = TBoxManager.subscribeProperty(tboxPropertyId, callback, interval);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
 try {
     TBoxManager.unsubscribeProperty(subscription);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 }
        ;
        Parameters:
        subscription - Identifies the successful subscription.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input subscription is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • unsubscribeAllProperty

        public static void unsubscribeAllProperty​()
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                          java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from all T-Box signal values that your application has subscribed to.

        Sample code for unsubscribing from all T-Box signal values: 

         
 try {
     TBoxManager.unsubscribeAllProperty();
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 }
        ;
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an error occurs at the service layer.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • subscribeBatchProperties

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TBoxSubscription> subscribeBatchProperties​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> propertyIds,
                                                                                        TBoxPropertyCallback callback,
                                                                                        long interval)
        Subscribes to specified T-Box signal values in batches.

        This method is intended for T-Box signal values using the same subscription period and callback.

        Sample code for subscribing to T-Box signal values in batches: 

         
 List<String> propertyIds = new ArrayList<>();
 propertyIds.add(TBoxManager.ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDEND);
 propertyIds.add(TBoxManager.ID_TBOX_BATTERYCHARGING_RESERVEDSTART);
 long interval = Long.MAX_VALUE;
 TboxPropertyCallbackImpl implements TboxPropertyCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(PropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 TboxPropertyCallbackImpl callback = new TboxPropertyCallbackImpl();
 Map<String, TBoxSubscription> result = TBoxManager.subscribeBatchProperties(propertyIds,
 callback, interval);
        ;
        Parameters:
        propertyIds - Indicates the IDs of T-Box signals to subscribe to.
        callback - Indicates the subscription callback.
        interval - Indicates the subscription period. For a periodic subscription, the value must be an integer multiple of 200 (minimum value: 200). For an aperiodic subscription, the value must be Long.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        Returns a map of IDs and subscription descriptors of T-Box signal values.

        You can determine whether the subscription of a specified signal value is successful based on the return value. Specifically, the subscription succeeded if its descriptor is not null and failed if its descriptor is null.

        Since:
        3
